The sun peered through the blinds inside a bedroom as a figure inside the bed squirmed and twisted about under the comforters and quilts.

And then right next to his head, his cellphone vibrated. A mop of brownish-going on pink hair looked up, droppy eyes blinking as a hand reached to the cellphone and flipped it open, seeing an email as arrived.

The boy, 13 year old Tatsuya Kaname, clicked the ‘open’ option and saw a message.

-
Hey Tatsuya my parents won’t be able to drive me to school today, so I can walk with ya today. Be up early because I am coming over for breakfast as well.
Homura
-

Tatsuya groaned as he closed his cellphone after inspecting the time and date(6:00 am and on Tuesday) and pulled the covers off of him and flipped his feet over the bed, feeling his feet on the cold wooden floor. He yawned again as he put on his PJs from the night before(he was wearing his underwear in bed) and walked like a zombie out of his bedroom.

For as long as he can remember, Akemi Homura has been his best friend. When some mean kids were pushing him off the playground, it would be she that would chase them off, usually with her Medusa-level glares and groin shots. With such kicking strength she could be a soccer prodigy.

But she always looked out for him, being the big sister he never had, always making sure he’s doing his studying(they study together) and protecting him from jerks and mean people. Why she cared about him was unknown to him. She was pretty he admitted, cute when he first met her, and pretty still.

Speaking of pretty girls, as he finished brushing his teeth and stepping into the shower, he always had weird dreams every other week. And it always involved a pink haired girl in some Magical Girl costume, usually white and pink. And she would smile in his direction…

Then he’d wake up, usually either in the middle of the night or in the morning. Why that girl was in his dreams confounded him. When he first got the dreams, he told his parents about it and his dad laughed on how he might be having wet dreams.

The memory made the boy roll his eyes as he stepped out of the shower and dried off and put on his clothes and walked down the hallway and down the stairs, feeling more refreshed as he walked into the kitchen quietly and saw a note on the table. He walked over and read it.

-

Hey Tatsuya-kun, this is Mama here!

Remember how last night you had cram school and went to bed right when you got home? Well…if incase Papa didn’t tell you, I had A LOT of work to do, so I had to stay over at a friend’s house in Shinjuku to help overlook the financial records and what not. Also, Papa just got an offer to represent his company and try and sell stock over in New York City! But it was an accept-now type of offer so he left on a 3 am flight I’m afraid…

Well besides the soon-to-be-stable economic future of our family, both me and your papa are unable to spend time with you. So so so so sorry!! DX.

But regardless, me and your papa love you very much. Papa will be home by this Friday and I’ll be back Thursday afternoon.

But, we both know you are very capable of running the house and keeping your grades up. If you ever feel lonely or overwhelmed, this is Papa’s words, bring in one of those girl-friends you know at school.

Love you! Mama
-
Tatsuya grinned. “Guess I’m gonna be home alone for two days.” He set the note back on the table and walked over the bread bin to get toast until he heard a knock on his door.

Knowing it’s Homura, Tatsuya ran over and opened the door…

The young man opened the door and what awaited him was his dear friend and occasional annoyance, Akemi Homura in all of her splendid stoic glory. A blank expression was present on her ivory colored face, however, one could read it as a sign of disappointment which Tatsuya knew all too well.

"Good morning Homu." Tatsuya motioned her to get inside, stepping away from the door. His friend had yet to move, the expression still present. He sighed as he knew what this meant. Homura would always have these weird quirks to her, even when they were children playing together. It was rather annoying for the youth to deal with, but she was his best friend and he needed to deal with it regardless of his own feelings. Walking back over to the girl, he patted her on the head, needing to stand on the tips of his toes as he was a mite bit shorter than his friend. He was still a growing boy, or that was what he would always say.

"Good morning Homura-homu-homu." said the younger boy with a dry tone to his face. That was a small name she had come up for herself and always wanted Tatsuya to greet her with it whenever they were alone. Homura gave a big smile and gave the boy a quick hug. "Now that wasn't that bad was it? Mou, you're always so mean to me Tatsuya-kun." said the girl, ruffling his hair and messing it up in the process. He struggled out of the hold.

"Yeah yeah, now please get inside, you're letting the bugs in the house." The girl did as told and entered the humble abode closing the door behind him. Taking off her shoes and hanged her school bag on the coat-rack and followed her friend into the kitchen. It was an hour or so before school began so the pair would always have breakfast together. Since Homura was a terrible cook, Tatsuya took it upon himself to cook for her. She rather enjoyed his meals so it was a win-win situation. "So what's on the menu today Tatsuya-kun?" she asked as Tatsuya faced away from her, busy preparing ingredients on the counter. Since time was limited he always opted for easy to make meals and the girl always insisted on eating more complex stuff. Luckily he decided to treat the girl this morning. He had planned to have crepes and the wraps were already made, all he needed to do was heat them up. Next was to make the cream filling and cut up the fruits that would be used.

"Its a surprise."
---
Homura eagerly awaited her breakfast, the scent of something sweet was lazing in the air. She really did wish that her friend would always be able to cook for her but they were in different years. She a junior and he was freshman. They would be parting sooner than later as university called out to her. Her melancholic thoughts were disrupted by the boy placing two crepes in front of her on a plate and covered with whip cream and fruit topping. "Here, eat up." A bite from her meal was enough to send her tastebuds right into heaven.

"Tatsuya-kun, won't you be my wife?" Both of the friends laughed at the statement, her thoughts of the future being drowned out for now.

Class had been rather boring for the pair, both of them were rather bright and things just seemed to drag on. While Tatsuya wouldn't admit it, Homura was always the bright point of his monotonous day. They walked down the city streets, looking for a place that was new just for the sake of it.

Lately, she had been wanting something grilled, like barbecued meat or chicken. But that was a bit out of their price-range. They were teenagers after all. So burgers at a fast food joint would suffice. Latching onto his arm, she began to lead him to her restaurant of choice.

"I want burgers Ta-kun." A slight tinge to his face, he let himself be pulled along by the girl, it couldn't hurt after all.
---
Walking through the double doors, a wave of cold air hit the two teens. Since it was nearing dinner time, the eatery was slightly packed, with longer lines and fewer tables to sit. Placing themselves into line, Homura noticed that many people in the restaurant were from their school. She had also noticed that a few of the girls had stuffed themselves to a great degree. She couldn't place it, but for some reasons she felt a great hunger coming from her midsection.

"Hey, you okay?" asked Tatsuya, seeing how Homura was in pain, it made him feel uneasy.

"O-Oh, I'm fine Ta-kun. I think I was just a bit more hungry than I thought." Placing a hand on his shoulder, she did her best to convince him that she was fine. Truth be told, she had no idea why her hunger had exploded like that, but she did not want to worry her close friend. Finally it was her turn in line and was greeted by the peppy cashier.

"Hi there, welcome to Flabby Pattys! May I take your order?" Looking at the menu display, a feeling came over the long-haired girl. A feeling of immense gluttony.

"I'll have a number six, a number 2, two number fours, a large soda and a strawberry milkshake." Without missing a beat, the cashier placed the order, used to such ridiculous requests. Telling the girl her total, Homura pulled out her cash to pay. Having felt his mouth go agape, the teen placed his order then went over to Homura was nearly drooling in anticipation of her upcoming meals.

"Hey Homura, mind telling me what that was about? I thought you were fine?"

"I am fine Ta-kun. I'm just feeling a bit more hungry than usual." Not entirely coerced, he placed a hand on her forehead to see if she had a fever or not. Her face becoming flushed, she placed one of her hands on top of his and entwining her fingers with his. "I had no idea you were so bold Tatsuya..." Recoiling his hand at a rapid pace, he turned his head away, trying to hide his embarrassment. Homura smiled at her friend, enjoying their little exchange. Perhaps she could teach the boy to act more bold in the future?

"Hey, you shouldn't worry there Madoka! The girl's got a good meal in her belly, that always fixes a stomach bug!" Sayaka smiled, giving a thumbs up of reassurance.

The class begun it's studies soon after. Being a mathematics lesson, there wasn't too much to be excited about. Everyone wrote down their sums, read their books and listen to their teacher, or at least listened to her when she wasn't ranting about her personal life.

At first, it seemed everything was alright for Homura. Her stomach had calmed down, the growling reducing over time. She heaved a sigh of relief, hoping it was the last she'd suffer of the strange hunger. Sadly, it was only a calm before the storm.

While listening into to what she was being taught, the hunger pangs begun again. But not just any kind, this was a massive one. The moment it hit her stomach, Homura froze in place. She dropped the pen she'd been holding, her eyes widening. Her entire belly felt like it was on fire, it was an intense pang.

That moment, Homura didn't just feel hungry. She felt starving. She felt like she hadn't eaten in days. Still frozen there, her mind was washed away. All other thoughts escaped her, soon to be replaced by new ones. That's when she began to think again.

Homura thought of all the food she wanted to eat. She was famished, she'd have anything. To think about everything that she could be eating right then, it was a banquet of the subconscious for her. Homura thought back to the lunch break, all the food she'd eaten. The pasta she'd demolished, the bread she'd inhaled, the chicken she'd devoured, the drinks she chugged. What she would give to eat that all again.

It only got worse, as her mind began to tease her ever so. The chicken parm in her thoughts marinaded in rich sauces. Seas of red lathered the meat and coated it's golden skin. It filled it's entire plate, bubbling with warmth and flavour. The portion looked enough to feed an entire family, but Homura wanted it all. Before her, the breads materialised and dipped themselves into the sauces. Drops fell from the sopping wet bread, the garlic mixing with the taste of the sauce. A pasta side dish, just as big as the plate joined it's side, a valley of steaming Italian delights caked with melted cheese and succulent ham. She swore she could smell the aromas the meals were giving off, only making her mind race even more.

The classroom didn't register. The people around her didn't register. Nothing what was being said was close to sinking in. All that was present to Homura was the foods of her dreams. She wanted to gorge herself on the food in her mind. She wanted to cram her face full of the treats in her thoughts. She would stuff herself forever more if she could. Hunger controlled her.

That is, until a hand grabbed her shoulder. As quick as it started, Homura's food fantasy was ended abruptly by the partially concerned and partially annoyed teacher.

"Miss Akemi, I was asking you to help us with the problem on the board. Are you feeling well?"

Back to reality, the pangs died down. Homura cleared her mind and responded quickly. "I should be fine, thank you." Shaking off the event as best as she could, she walked up to the board and picked up the whiteboard pen.

Dim lamps lit the sidewalks, amber lights just barely providing vision in the darkened night. The many stores that littered the streets were currently closed, a few neon signs still turned on despite their store sake being shut for the night. Not a single soul was present at the time, the streets devoid of any kind of life. That is, until the appearance of a certain girl.

"What kinda moron leaves their keys in plain sight on their desk anyways?" The girl said aloud, talking to no one but herself. Twirling a set of keys on her fingers, she strolled through an open door and walked around the mass complex. This lady was currently residing a massive warehouse, filled with a massive amount of boxes and storage space. With good reason too, as this warehouse was part of a store chain, this warehouse being their main source of products for the grocery stores throughout the city.

"Heh, this was even easier than last time!" The girl chuckled to herself, as she walked towards a pile of many boxes, all stacked up onto each other. With reckless abandon, she tore open the boxes and looked inside for it's contents.

"Just what I've been looking for!" With no hesitating, she began to take the contents from the boxes she opened and stuff them into her pockets, soon followed by merely carrying them with both arms when her pockets were full. These contents in question was food, a plentiful supply of sweet and sour snack foods which would be expected from a store that sells food.

For this girl, it would be most useful. This lady was Kyoko Sakura, who shared the same occupation as one Mami Tomoe, the role as a Magical Girl. Just like Mami, Kyoko had been in the business for many a year, but not as much as the blonde haired girl. However, while Mami was devoted to her work, Kyoko went beyond that. Being a Magical Girl was all that she thought about, leading her to focus all her time on honing her abilities. What better way to do so than to bulk herself up to maximise her magical strength?

Years of gorging and stuffing had made Kyoko huge. Her original blue shirt had be vastly outgrown, her rounded ball of a belly freely hanging out and over her waist. The shirt barely fit her anymore, just barely covering her breasts along with her black undershirt which too struggled to cover and contain her chest. While she originally wore a pair of blue shorts, she had opted for a pair of blue jeans instead to compensate for her gaining. Not wanting to have her huge rear end on display for the world to see, she pretty much needed to swipe a pair of jeans to make sure she didn't garner any unwanted attention. Even then, the jeans acted more like shorts nowadays, just barely covering her fat filled cheeks and holding her jiggling thighs. Brown boots had turned into brown sandals, having been worn and ripped apart with thousands of steps.

Stroking a hand through her cascading red hair, Kyoko opened one of her many snack boxes and dunked the contents past her plump lips. Slow heavy chews followed by a loud gulp made the girl sigh happily.

"Mmmm....never get enough of 'em." She gave her belly a few pats. "This'll do me fine for the next few days. What I'd give to live here, if those security guards would be so kind to keep off my ass...."

Just then, Kyoko felt something click in her brain. A strange feeling encompassed her senses. It was all too weird. "What the hell...."

She then felt a burning sensation. which she inspected. She noticed the source coming from her soul gem, which was shining brighter than she had ever seen it before.

"Don't tell me there's some kind of Witch at this time of night? It doesn't make sense!" She was initially confused, but this was only amplified as she saw a streak of light in the sky through the windows in the roof of the warehouse. As soon as the streak disappeared from her sight, the burning stopped and her soul gem went back to it's usual form.

"Yeah, I gotta check that out." Cramming as much food into her mouth as possible as not to waste it, she began to make a quick pace out of the warehouse to follow the streak of light.
